title: Since the Day I Was Born
lyrics:
My heart is on the ground (On the ground)
It's been there for too long (Too long, too long)
Cheap words slip through my mouth (Through my mouth)
I'd rather show you that I can be strong
Oh, I think I want to go home where I belong (I belong)

Singin', moon river movin' west on the 84

Death be callin' my name since the day I was born

Only this time, I'm not afraid anymore



I been running like the wind, packing up again

Singin' like my life depends on it

Yeah I'm running like the wind, never settled in

Funny how my life depends on it

'Cause my heart beat's from the ground, ooh

You can listen if you learn my song

(You can listen, you can listen if you learn my song)



I think I want to go home where I belong (I belong)

Singin', good vibrations movin' south down the 101

Death be callin' my name since the day I was born

Only this time, I'm not afraid anymore



I think I wanna go home

Where the trees get tall lookin' out from my bedroom window

Wanna go home

Where my dad works hard and my mom is a hero

I wanna go home

Back to pick up games and anything playing on the radio

Where do I go?

Where do I go?



I think I want to go

I would laugh in the cul-de-sac where I learned to skate

I wanna go

Playing air guitar by the lake and there were no mistakes

No mistakes
